info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 6:25PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alexander, Caldwell and Burke Counties through 700 PM EST... At 625 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Morganton, or near Table Rock, moving northeast at 90 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Morganton, Sawmills, Valdese, Gamewell, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Drexel, Rutherford College and Glen Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for western North Carolina.
